channel.title: NASA Space Station News
channel.description: A RSS news feed containing the latest NASA press releases on the International Space Station.

item.title: Louisiana Students to Hear from NASA Astronauts Aboard Space Station
item.description: As part of the state's first Earth-to-space call, students from Louisiana will have an opportunity soon to hear from NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.
NASA has selected KBR Wyle Services, LLC, of Fulton, Maryland, to provide mission and flight crew operations support for the International Space Station and future human space exploration.

item.title: NASA Expands Options for Spacewalking, Moonwalking Suits
item.description: NASA has awarded Axiom Space and Collins Aerospace task orders under existing contracts to advance spacewalking capabilities in low Earth orbit, as well as moonwalking services for Artemis missions.

item.title: NASA to Provide Coverage as Dragon Departs Station
item.description: NASA is set to receive scientific research samples and hardware as a SpaceX Dragon cargo resupply spacecraft departs the International Space Station on Thursday, June 29.

item.title: NASA Plans Coverage of Roscosmos Spacewalk Outside Space Station
item.description: Compared to earlier spacecraft, the International Space Station has many luxuries, but laundry facilities are not one of them. Instead, astronauts have other options.
